Title: Another Y Combinator clone, in Lexington, KY

Author: derefr
Content: Suspicious because your mobile device, which you'd really only use when out of the house and therefore around strangers, would be protected from those strangers?

Author: axod
Content:
So the browser stops supporting cookies does it? Even if the browser does stop sending cookies to google, they could do pretty good tracking based on useragent/ip.

However, a browser that doesn't support cookies correctly, isn't very useful.

The browsers history is completely irrelevant.

From the article: "others using the same computer will not be able to see which sites have been accessed."

That is not the same as "Cookies sent from google will no longer work"

Author: DenisM
Content:
One thing that holds me back is, ironically, lack of scale options.

500Mb limits with no way to go beyond (paid or not) will have to go before I even start planning to move there. It's a pity, because automatic scale was so promising.

Author: rglovejoy
Content:
Unlikely. The distance between the Earth and the Sun varies throughout the year, but it all evens out. When you are trying to figure out the age of a sample that may be thousands of years old, these variations are just noise and nothing significant.

What would be interesting is how the decay rate on the nuclear generators aboard Pioneers 10 & 11 and Voyagers 1 & 2 have varied as they traveled away from the Sun over the past 30-40 years. See:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radioisotope_thermoelectric_gen...
